description: ch (from plant) + otaiin (movement/flow pattern); herbal flow, plant's directional growth
reasoning: Strong ch- prefix (herba/from plant) + otaiin (cursus/flow). Combined: describes plant growth direction or flow pattern (vines, tendrils, spreading growth).

description: ot (from/out of) + chey (element/small part); from element, elemental component
reasoning: ot (ex/from) prefix + chey (elementum/element). Botanical context: component from plant, elemental part (oil, juice, essence extracted from plant).

description: o (exclamation) + aiin (is/state marker); it is, statement of being
reasoning: o (exclamation/emphasis) + aiin (est/state). Combined: emphatic statement of being/existence. Context: declarative statement about plant state or property.

description: r (and/connector) + aiin (is/state marker); and it is, connective state
reasoning: r (et/and) + aiin (est/state). Combined: connects clauses with existential statement. Common pattern for listing plant properties.

description: d (gives) + chaiin (was/past state); gave was, past giving state
reasoning: d (dat/gives) + chaiin (erat/was). Combined: past tense giving/providing. Context: plant gave/provided something in past (seasonal yield, historical use).

description: k (makes) + chaiin (was/past state); made was, past making state
reasoning: k (facit/makes) + chaiin (erat/was). Combined: past tense making/producing. Context: plant made/produced something previously.

description: t (touches) + cheey (small); touches small, contacts small part
reasoning: t (tangit/touches) + cheey (parvum/small). Combined: touches or contacts small parts. Context: fine details, delicate plant structures (stamens, pistils, fine hairs).

description: ol (that/it) + aiin (is/state marker); that is, demonstrative statement
reasoning: ol (ille/that) + aiin (est/state). Combined: demonstrative existential statement. Context: 'that (plant/part) is...' declarative identification.
